meanings.definition: A person who eats quickly or greedily.
meanings.sent1: The scarfer finished his meal in record time.
meanings.sent2: The kids at the party were scarfers when it came to the pizza.
meanings.sent3: The scarfer at the buffet was like a vacuum cleaner, sucking up all the food.
meanings.sent4: She was a scarfer at the potluck, devouring everything in sight.
meanings.sent5: The scarfer's appetite was as big as a bear's before hibernation.

meanings.sent1: He scarfered down his sandwich before rushing off to work.
meanings.sent2: During the picnic, everyone scarfered the delicious barbecue.
meanings.sent3: She scarfered her dessert as if it were the last piece of cake on Earth.
meanings.sent4: The team scarfered the pizza after winning the championship game.
meanings.sent5: The hungry dog scarfered the treats left on the kitchen counter.

meanings.definition: A long, narrow, decorative piece of cloth worn around the neck.
meanings.sent1: She wore a beautiful scarfer with her winter coat.
meanings.sent2: In the fashion show, the models flaunted various scarfers.
meanings.sent3: The magician used a scarfer as part of his disappearing act.
meanings.sent4: The pirate captain's scarfer fluttered in the wind as he steered the ship.
meanings.sent5: The queen's scarfer was embroidered with intricate patterns and jewels.
